name: Laryngeal_Cancer_v6.1
remarks: This modules aim is to generate laryngeal cancer patients, with the focus on survival. We tried to provide a sources for every transition, which can be found in the state remarks of the transition of the preceeding state. For some transitions we were not able to find reliable sources and estimated the distributions. In this cases you can find that information in the state remarks.
For more information on how to use the module and its features please visit our git: https://git.iccas.de/synthea/laryngeal-cancer
Symptoms occurring up to 1 year before diagnosis of laryngeal carcinoma.
Source: Recognising laryngeal cancer in primary care: a large case–control study using electronic records, Elizabeth A Shephard (2019)
Hyperlink: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/30692092/

remarks: The development of  laryngeal cancer will be diagnosed in the Encounter "Encountor_Tumor_Board".

remarks: The patient does not consume alcohol.
No_Alcohol_Observation.name: No_Alcohol_Observation

remarks: The patient consumes up to 10 standard drinks per week. Equal to up to 120g ethanol per week.
Occasionally_A_Observation.name: Occasionally_A_Observation

remarks: The patient consumes between 11 and 20 standard drinks per week. Equal to 132 - 240g ethanol per week.
Regular_A_Obseravtion.name: Regular_A_Obseravtion

remarks: The patient consumes more than 20 standard drinks per week. Equal to up to 240 - 600 g ethanol per week.
Excessive_A_Observation.name: Excessive_A_Observation

remarks: The patient uesed to consume more than 20 standard drinks per week. Equal to up to 240 - 600 g ethanol per week.

M0_Diagnosed.name: M0_Diagnosed

remarks: In the Config area you can choose between the different the different survival and age distribution modes of the module.
Config.name: Config

remarks: With this attribute you can choose between the different types of age and gender distributions. To do this, change the "age_risk_distribution" attribute. Available modes:
1 - Generates as many laryngeal carcinoma patients as possible. Does not consider prevalence, incidence and sex distribution.
2 - Generates population with occurrence of laryngeal carcinoma patients based on real age and sex specific disease probability.
For a more detailed explanation please visit our git: https://git.iccas.de/synthea/laryngeal-cancer

No_Regional_Lymph_Node_Metastasis.name: No_Regional_Lymph_Node_Metastasis

remarks: Note: This transition is an estimated distribution of the two imaging techniques  for diagnosis. According to the German S3 guideline, MRI is the method of first choice, whereas CT is used only in individual cases. Therefor, a distribution of 9:1 was estimated.
Source: german S3-Guideline diagnostics, therapy and follow-up of laryngeal carcinoma (Long version)
Hyperlink: https://www.leitlinienprogramm-onkologie.de/leitlinien/larynxkarzinom/
Larynx_MRI_Or_CT.name: Larynx_MRI_Or_CT

remarks: According to the German S3 guideline, only patients with an N classification > N1 should receive a sonography of the abdomen and MRI or CT of the thorax and abdomen.
Source: german S3-Guideline diagnostics, therapy and follow-up of laryngeal carcinoma (Long version)
Hyperlink: https://www.leitlinienprogramm-onkologie.de/leitlinien/larynxkarzinom/

remarks: Postoperative radiotherapy should be started as early as possible after completion of the wound healing and should be completed within a maximum period of 11 weeks after weeks after surgery.
Source: https://www.leitlinienprogramm-onkologie.de/fileadmin/user_upload/Downloads/Leitlinien/Larynxkarzinom/Version1.1/LL_Larynxkarzinom_Langversion_1.1.pdf
Delay_Wound_Healing.name: Delay_Wound_Healing

remarks: With this attribute you can choose between the different types of survival calculation. To do this, change the "survival_mode
" attribute. Available modes:
1 - The survival is calculated in dependency of age, sex and UICC staging.

2 - ATTENTION: This mode is not finished in this version. It uses a lot of estimated dependencies and therefore can produce unrealistic data. The survival is calculated in dependency of age, sex, UICC staging, smoking status, drinking status, grading, performance status and therapy.
For a more detailed explanation please visit our git: https://git.iccas.de/synthea/laryngeal-cancer
Set_Survival_Mode.name: Set_Survival_Mode

remarks: Source: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/34609937/
Treatment_T4a.name: Treatment_T4a

remarks: Source: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33151575/
Paliative_Therapy.name: Paliative_Therapy

remarks: Performance Status according to the WHO (ECOG):
0 = Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction
1 = Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g.,
light house work, office work
2 = Ambulatory and capable of all self care but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours.
3 = Capable of only limited self care, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.
4 = Completely disabled. Cannot carry on any self care. Totally confined to bed or chair.
5 = Death
